headline: Coach Parent Tapestry Lifts Full-Year Outlook, Says Tariffs 'Immaterial'
summary: Shares of Tapestry rose Thursday after the owner of fashion brands reported better-than-expected fiscal third-quarter results and lifted its full-year outlook.

raw.headline: Coach Parent Tapestry Lifts Full-Year Outlook, Says Tariffs 'Immaterial'

headline: Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) Surprises With Strong Q1, Stock Soars
summary: Luxury fashion conglomerate Tapestry (NYSE:TPR) reported Q1 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 6.9% year on year to $1.58 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $6.95 billion at the midpoint came in 1.1% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.95 per share was 7.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Tapestry Tops Q3 Estimates and Raises Outlook Despite Difficult Backdrop
summary: Shares of the Coach parent rose in early trading as CEO Joanne Crevoiserat said the company retained “a bias for action.”

headline: Tapestry: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: NEW YORK (AP) — Tapestry Inc. TPR) on Thursday reported fiscal third-quarter profit of $203.3 million. The New York-based company said it had net income of 95 cents per share.

raw.headline: Tapestry: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: NEW YORK (AP) — Tapestry Inc. TPR) on Thursday reported fiscal third-quarter profit of $203.3 million. The New York-based company said it had net income of 95 cents per share.

headline: Tapestry lifts forecasts on booming demand for Coach handbags
summary: (Reuters) -Tapestry on Thursday raised its 2025 revenue and profit forecasts for a third time this year, benefiting from higher full-price sale of its popular Coach handbags and limited exposure to the sweeping U.S. tariffs.  Steady demand for the company's Tabby, Brooklyn and Empire leather handbags among younger shoppers in North America, Europe and China helped it beat third-quarter results expectations.  "Tapestry, has found a sweet spot in the luxury food chain ... siphoning off high-end customers now reconsidering whether they really need a five-figure handbag," said Michael Ashley Schulman, chief investment officer at Running Point Capital Advisors.

raw.headline: Tapestry lifts forecasts on booming demand for Coach handbags
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Tapestry on Thursday raised its 2025 revenue and profit forecasts for a third time this year, benefiting from higher full-price sale of its popular Coach handbags and limited exposure to the sweeping U.S. tariffs.  Steady demand for the company's Tabby, Brooklyn and Empire leather handbags among younger shoppers in North America, Europe and China helped it beat third-quarter results expectations.  "Tapestry, has found a sweet spot in the luxury food chain ... siphoning off high-end customers now reconsidering whether they really need a five-figure handbag," said Michael Ashley Schulman, chief investment officer at Running Point Capital Advisors.

headline: Tapestry, Inc. Reports Fiscal 2025 Third Quarter Results and Raises Full Year Outlook
summary: NEW YORK, May 08, 2025--Tapestry, Inc. (NYSE: TPR), a house of iconic accessories and lifestyle brands consisting of Coach, Kate Spade, and Stuart Weitzman, today reported results for the fiscal third quarter ended March 29, 2025.
